name: dualrnaseq-host-pathogen
title: Host-Pathogen Dual RNA-seq (nf-core/dualrnaseq)
description: Analyze host-pathogen interactions through simultaneous RNA-seq of both organisms. Quantifies gene expression in both host (human, mouse) and bacterial pathogen during infection, revealing molecular mechanisms of infection and immune response. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,replicate`
content:
Host-Pathogen Dual RNA-seq

The nf-core/dualrnaseq pipeline analyzes RNA-seq data from infected samples containing both host and pathogen RNA. This reveals molecular interactions during infection by simultaneously quantifying gene expression in both organisms.

Scientific Applications

  • Infection Biology: Study host immune response and pathogen virulence
  • Drug Discovery: Identify therapeutic targets in host or pathogen
  • Bacterial Pathogenesis: Understand mechanisms of infection
  • Immune Response: Characterize host defense mechanisms
  • Co-evolution: Study host-pathogen molecular adaptations

What Makes This Different

Regular RNA-seq analyzes one organism. Dual RNA-seq simultaneously:

  • Maps reads to combined host + pathogen genomes
  • Separates and quantifies expression for each organism
  • Reveals coordinated gene expression changes during infection

Input Requirements

Samplesheet + Reference genomes for both organisms:

  • Host FASTA and GFF (human, mouse, etc.)
  • Pathogen FASTA and GFF (bacteria)
  • Sample sheet: standard RNA-seq format

Key Outputs

  • Separate expression tables for host and pathogen
  • QC reports for both organisms
  • Mapping statistics showing host/pathogen read distribution

Perfect for: Infection biologists • Immunologists • Microbiologists • Drug discovery • Pathogen researchers
